db:abstract.db:para: A request for selecting a color by the user.
This type was introduced in QtWebEngine 1.4.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A ColorDialogRequest is passed as an argument of the WebEngineView::colorDialogRequested signal. It is generated when a color picker dialog is requested. See HTML5 Color State.

The accepted property of the request indicates whether the request is handled by the user code or the default dialog should be displayed. If you set the accepted property to true, make sure to call either dialogAccept() or dialogReject() afterwards.

db:section.db:title: accepted : bool
db:section.db:para: Indicates whether the color picker dialog request has been accepted by the signal handler.

If the property is false after any signal handlers for WebEngineView::colorDialogRequested have been executed, a default color picker dialog will be shown. To prevent this, set request.accepted to true.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] color : color
db:section.db:para: The default color to be selected in the dialog.

db:section.db:title: void dialogAccept(color color)
db:section.db:para: This function notifies the engine that the user accepted the dialog, providing the color.

db:section.db:title: void dialogReject()
db:section.db:para: This function notifies the engine that the user rejected the dialog.
